episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and intriguing topics, including the unintended consequences of receiving a Michelin star, the breeding of designer snakes with unique patterns, the peculiar claim of the Catholic diocese of Orlando over the moon, and the unusual case of a movie being based on a novel that was written after the film was made.

facts.fact: If you run a restaurant, one of the best ways to sabotage a rival is to get them a Michelin star.
In America, you can buy designer snakes with emojis on them.
The largest Catholic diocese is Orlando, because it includes the moon.
The Oscar-winning movie, The Summer of '42, is the only movie to be based on a novel that was written after the movie was made.
